content: The iconic Hollywood sign originally read something else. What did it say when it was first erected in 1923?

The Hollywood Sign originally read "Hollywoodland" when it was first erected in 1923. It was created as an advertisement for a new housing development in the Hollywood Hills. The sign was intended to be temporary, but it became a famous landmark and was later preserved and repaired multiple times. In 1949, the last four letters ("LAND") were removed, and the sign has read "HOLLYWOOD" ever since.
